title: Famille Hauller 2015 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)
description: The nose gives away as little as the palate. This is a rather neutral, dry white wine with fresh acidity and some bitter edges, almost bare of fruit apart from some citrus freshness, yet the wine is very clean. It will work for a thirsty crowd at a summer party.

title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Yellow plum and fresh lemon seem to have an earthy tinge and some bitter edges on the palate. But this wine still offers lively enough fruit and some texture.

title: Domaine François Schmitt 2014 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Simple, fresh yellow-apple fruit is met with some citrus freshness on the clean palate that could do with a little more precision. Nonetheless, this is neutral, versatile and fresh.

title: Junta 2014 Momentos Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Valley)
description: Light, spicy aromas of tea, rubber, cherry and raspberry are earthy. This feels light, dilute and dry. Flavors of mulchy red fruits come with notes of tomato and pepper, as does the finish.

title: Belle Ambiance 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Fresh apple, peach and generous flavors of vanilla and coconut rest on a pillowy texture. The wine is fruity and light, without noticeable acidity.

title: Beso de Vino 2014 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Grapy and perfumed on the nose, this quaffable Garnacha is sound and fresh, albeit a bit acidic. Black-fruit flavors are common and show notes of earth and chocolate, while a grabby finish displays no glaring faults.

title: Mano A Mano 2013 Manon Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Spicy, leathery berry aromas are aggressive. This Tempranillo feels grabby and rubbery, while saucy berry and plum flavors lean in the direction of stewy. A finish with rustic berry flavors runs long.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Marchesi De Gregorio 2015 Vermentino del marchese White (Sicilia)
description: This offers aromas and flavors suggesting unripe apricot, peach and lime. The simple palate is a bit raw, but crisp acidity gives it clean, bright finish.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Satinela Semi Dulce White (Rioja)
description: This semisweet Viura-Malvasia blend is neutral on the nose, then sweet as expected on the palate, with upfront residual sugar driving a flavor profile that includes mango, banana and apple juice. Sugary and bit cloying from start to finish, but good acidity keeps it in balance.

title: Carayon la Rose 2015 Rosé (Languedoc)
description: A soft, strawberry flavored wine that is smooth and immediately attractive. Despite its low alcohol, it has a ripe feel to it from the rich fruit and the almost off-dry character. The acidity gently kicks in at the end.

title: Castillo de Monséran 2014 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Rubbery black plum and berry aromas lead to a fresh, tight palate with astringent tannins. Generic berry flavors are angular, while this everyday Garnacha is tannic and scratchy on the finish.

title: Château Cazeau 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is textured and fruity. Crisp citrus and red-currant fruits are layered with bright acidity and a refreshing aftertaste. The wine could do with a few more months before drinking, so wait until late 2016.

title: Bota Box 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light-bodied, dry wine smells fresh and fruity, tastes like crisp apples and honeydew melon, and has a soft texture that makes it easy to sip.

title: Clos Floridène 2015 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: From the home estate of wine academic and guru Denis Dubourdieu, this tight, nervy wine has a mineral character rounded by wild-strawberry flavors. An attractive citrus tang gives it good bite at the end. Drink now.

title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreamfish Cabernet Sauvignon (Romania)
description: This Romanian Cabernet Sauvignon smells like black raspberry, cherry vanilla and a touch of mint. There are flavors of red berries and red plum on the palate.

title: We Are Sonoma NV Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Made in stainless-steel tanks and a mix of French and American oak barrels, this new, low-priced, low-in-alcohol white is straightforward in its rich layers of butterscotch and tropical vanilla, with a roundness that many will find attractive.

title: Willm 2015 Gentil White (Alsace)
description: Bruised apple notes precede a friendly, easy, soft, apple-scented wine with a light and dry body. Drink soon while aromas last.

title: Kudos 2015 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: Strong flavors of clove and mint dominate this unusual Riesling. It's quite dry, with good penetration, though a world apart from most of its peers. With the right food (Thai?), the potent flavors might prove complementary.

title: Tortoise Creek 2013 The Revivalist Merlot (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells like a cherry pie, tastes quite ripe and fruity, and has a smooth texture and lightly sweet finish.

title: Santa Carolina 2015 Reserva Estate Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Pointy cherry, tomato and horsey aromas announce a fresh, raw palate. Bright, peppery red plum and citrus flavors finish lean, dry and grating.

title: William Hill Estate 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Light strawberry, tart cherry and fruit-punch aromas arise on the nose of this widely available bottling. It's quite soft and weak on the palate, with red cherries, strawberries and a touch of thyme.

title: Willm 2015 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose is closed and gives away little. Fresh, clean and lemony, the palate is colored slightly by fresh pear but there is not much besides. Drink as fresh as possible.

title: 75 Wine Co. 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has veggie and grapefruit aromas and unapologetic herbal flavors on a fairly crisp texture.

title: Clos Pons 2013 Sisquella White (Costers del Segre)
description: Smoky, sulfuric aromas put you on alert. This strange Catalonian blend of Garnacha Blanca, Albariño and Moscatel feels solid and centered, while salty papaya flavors are a touch bitter. A finish with little flavor but good texture close this out.

title: Damia 2012 1637 Seleccion Especial Brut Rosado Sparkling (Cava)
description: A funk city nose is far from fresh and familiar—look for aromas of vitamins, pickled cabbage and warm, dusty radiator. A slightly rough full-sized palate tastes briny and funky, with little fruit. This is chunky, briny tasting and salty on the finish.

title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Juliette Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: A blend from a wider area than just Côtes de Provence, the wine is lightly spicy, full of red fruits and citrus acidity. There is a typical touch of pepper that adds extra interest to what is a refreshing wine.

title: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2013 Riesling (Alsace)
description: Plump, almost overripe yellow plums are ample on the nose. The palate rescues this somewhat with freshness, but flavor and taste seem slightly disjointed.

title: Bott Frères 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Some notes of bruised apple appear on the nose. The palate has some bitter notes but provides the sort of textured midpalate that works well with soft cheeses.

title: Byington 2013 Liage Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Smelling like a freshly mowed lawn, the nose on this bottling also offers that funky cut tennis ball and sour-apple aroma common in some Sauv Blancs. There is strong acidity once sipped, and a stony structure frames dried green apple and sour grass flavors.

title: Succulent Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Light aromas, light body and delicate peach and apple flavors make this slightly sweet wine simple and refreshing.
